title: Project Kickoff
description: Defined the scope of the nature learning journal. Chose study sites, set up field equipment, and outlined the key questions we wanted to explore over the coming months.

title: First Soil Study
description: Completed the first detailed soil profile analysis. Discovered rich mycorrhizal networks and documented over 20 invertebrate species in a single plot.

title: Creek Ecosystem Discovery
description: Found a hidden creek ecosystem beneath old-growth cedars. Documented caddisfly larvae, salamanders, and a complex food web in a tiny habitat.

title: Weather Reading Week
description: Began a week-long experiment predicting weather using only natural observation. No apps, no forecasts â€” just clouds, wind, and barometric pressure.

title: Summit Sunrise
description: Completed the dawn summit hike. Documented alpine conditions and captured the golden light moment that became one of our most memorable field experiences.

title: Fungi Explosion
description: After three days of autumn rain, cataloged fourteen mushroom species in a single afternoon. Discovered honey fungus rhizomorphs connecting multiple trees.

title: Elk Tracking Success
description: Three days of patient tracking led to observing a herd of thirty elk in their autumn grazing meadow. Practiced wildlife observation protocols.

title: Desert Stargazing
description: Drove to a dark sky location for a night of unassisted astronomy. Identified constellations, Jupiter's moons, and experienced the full Milky Way arc.

title: Old-Growth Pilgrimage
description: Visited a rare old-growth grove with 500-year-old Douglas firs. Reflected on conservation, timescale, and what it means to protect irreplaceable ecosystems.

title: Journal Compilation Complete
description: Finished compiling all field notes, observations, photographs, and findings into this digital scrapbook journal. A season of learning distilled into a single resource.
